context: The Finnish verb 'täyttää' has multiple meanings depending on context. It can mean 'to fill' (as in filling a container or form), 'to fulfill' (meeting requirements or expectations), 'to complete' (finishing something), and 'to satisfy' (meeting someone's needs or desires). The word is formed from the root 'täy-' (full) plus the verb suffix '-tää', indicating it relates to making something full.
